section.p: 1. The ages are given in the title.
2. The figures for 'no time' and from three to seven or more hours show this is true.
3. The figures for 'no time' and from three to seven or more hours show this is true.
4. The figure is just under 45 per cent, which is approximately half.

p.font: 6. 'Very active' means spending 7 or more hours on sport and exercise per week. 18% of young men spend 7 or more hours a week on these activities. What's another way of saying 18 per cent?

section.p: 7. The report says 'very active', which must mean 7 hours or more per week.
8. Only 5 per cent of young women spend 7 or more hours on these activities.
9. 22 per cent of young men and women spend 1 to 3 hours on these activities.
10. The percentage is 22 per cent, which is just over 1 in 5.
11. Adding the percentages for women in the last four columns gives a total of 40 per cent, which is two-fifths.
12. Add up the last four columns for men. What total percentage does this give? How can this be expressed as a fraction?
